alert.note: Alert for Moffat; Rio Blanco (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued February 14 at 3:10PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR OZONE FROM 300 PM TUESDAY UNTIL 300 AM WEDNESDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Ozone. WHERE...locations below 7,000 feet in southwest Moffat County and areas west of Kenney Reservoir in western Rio Blanco County. Cities and points of interest include, but are not limited to Rangely and Dinosaur National Monument. WHEN...300 PM Tuesday February 14 to 300 AM Wednesday February 15 IMPACTS...Ozone concentrations are expected to be in the Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups category though at least Tuesday evening and into the early hours of Wednesday morning. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: Increasing likelihood of respiratory symptoms and breathing discomfort in active children and adults and people with lung disease, such as asthma. Active children and adults, and people with lung disease, such as asthma, should reduce prolonged or heavy outdoor exertion.
